# Chord: Minor Major 7th in C# (Shape: G)

## Description
The Minor Major 7th chord is a rich and jazzy chord that combines the minor triad with a major 7th interval. In the key of C#, the G form of the Minor Major 7th chord consists of the notes G#, B, D#, and F#. This chord creates a sense of tension and mystery due to the dissonant qualities of the minor third (G# to B) and major 7th (G# to F#) intervals.

## Notes and Intervals
- G# (Root)
- B (Minor 3rd)
- D# (Perfect 5th)
- F# (Major 7th)

## Genre and Musical Flavor
The Minor Major 7th chord is commonly found in jazz, R&B, and soul music. It adds a sophisticated and melancholic flavor to compositions, often used to evoke a sense of longing or introspection. This chord can bring depth and complexity to a musical piece, and its unique sound can create interesting harmonic progressions.
